title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are better positioned to acquire key players after making playoffs in 2025.
Red Sox face roster challenges with potential opt-outs from Alex Bregman, Lucas Giolito, and Trevor Story.
Boston has financial flexibility and a strong farm system to improve its roster this offseason.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel denies Patriots changes are to distance from past success, focusing on current team performance.
Patriots introduced offensive starters individually, breaking 24-year team introduction tradition in recent game.
Changes like ditching victory chant reflect new approach; Patriots lead AFC East at 6-2 halfway through season.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm of the Boston Bruins will miss several weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained in a game against the Sabres.
Marat Khusnutdinov has been promoted to the Bruins' top line to fill Lindholm's role alongside David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie.
Lindholm was leading the Bruins' power play with four goals before his injury, ranking second in the league for power-play goals.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Tourists in full costume flocked to Salem, Massachusetts, causing bustling streets during Halloween 2025 celebrations.
Salem's downtown hosted markets, street performances, and Halloween-themed decor, attracting a vibrant mix of visitors.
Visitors honored the Salem Witch Trials Memorial by leaving flowers, money, and bracelets on graves.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused President Trump of abusing young girls with Jeffrey Epstein without offering any proof.
Moulton made the accusations during a tense interview with MSNBC host Joe Scarborough, who challenged his claims.
Moulton's comments come as he challenges Sen. Ed Markey in the 2026 Democratic primary, focusing on Republican corruption.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's next competency hearing is set for November 14, with jury selection starting on November 18.
Cellphone evidence from former State Police Trooper Michael Proctor's phone will be preserved for Walshe's defense.
The court allowed defendants to access Proctor's phone files, barring public disclosure, amid ongoing legal disputes.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market over the Massachusetts Turnpike reopened after a three-day closure for asbestos concerns.
Asbestos was contained in a sealed stockroom, posing no risk to the public, per health inspectors.
Air and surface tests showed no asbestos presence; abatement work will continue in a controlled environment.

title: ‘He has everything to score 50’: Morgan Geekie is evolving into an elite goal scorer for Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Morgan Geekie is on pace for 57 goals this season, leading the Bruins with his strong shot and scoring instinct.
Geekie's current six-game goal streak includes a 95.68 mph shot, the fastest in the NHL this season.
Despite a high shooting percentage, Geekie is adapting his play, becoming a key power play asset alongside David Pastrnak.

title: Celtics reportedly exercise team option for 2024 1st-round pick Baylor Scheierman
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics exercise team option on Baylor Scheierman, keeping him through 2026-2027 season.
Scheierman, the 30th pick in 2024, has played limited minutes, averaging 8.5 minutes and 3 points per game.
Boston values Scheierman's passing and hustle, despite his shooting not fully translating from college.

title: Keion White admits he wasn’t fit for Patriots’ scheme, while 49ers want to tap into ‘limitless potential’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots traded Keion White and a seventh-round pick to the 49ers for a sixth-round pick.
White struggled in the Patriots' defensive scheme, leading to reduced playing time and only six tackles this season.
49ers see White's potential as an inside rusher, intending to harness his versatility and "limitless potential."
